main event: A small black particle followed by a ball of fire was observed in the sky over the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object was round and small in size.
The object was followed by a bright ball of fire comparable in size to the object itself.
The object moved from northwest to southwest and faded into the water.
The sighting was made by the captain of a vessel, Capt. Ben Gertulla, from Oregon State University.
The weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a small black particle followed by a bright ball of fire
witnesses: Capt. Ben Gertulla, captain of a vessel from Oregon State University
